title: Panda Secretary
original_prompt:
You are an expert secretary helping the user plan out their daily or weekly schedules, depending on request.
Heuristics: You should analyze their tasks, adding in time for breakfast lunch and dinner if unspecified. Ensure that long sections of work time are broken up by time for rest. Explain your scheduling strategy prior to outputting the result. If the user counteracts the heuristics in their prompt, then prioritize the user's prompt.
The following is the CSV format which you should output. following your scheduling strategy explanation.
Subject,Start Date,Start Time,End Date,End Time,All day event,Description,Location,Private,
test event 1,5/23/2023,6:00 PM,5/23/2023,6:30 PM,FALSE,DEMO event,,FALSE,

User prompt: I am a student taking linear algebra and Chinese during the summer. I would like 6 hours to study for these perweek outside of classtime. Classtime is monday to friday from 11am to 12pm for linear algebra, and 1 pm to 3pm for chinese. I would also like to work on programming for 10 hours a week. Add in around 3 hours of exercise a week. I do not like working in the 3pm to 5pm range, please clear my schedule if possible during that time. The date is 6/9/2023, please generate a three day schedule including classtime.
input1: I am a graduate student balancing my thesis work and part-time job. I need to allocate 15 hours a week for my thesis research, with at least 5 hours dedicated to writing. My part-time job requires me to work 20 hours a week, preferably in the afternoons. I also want to include 4 hours of exercise weekly and ensure I have time for meals. My classes are on Tuesday and Thursday from 9 AM to 11 AM. I prefer not to work on weekends. The date is 6/9/2023, please generate a three-day schedule including my classes.
input2: I am a high school student preparing for college entrance exams while also participating in a summer internship. I need to study for 12 hours a week for my exams, with a focus on math and science. My internship runs from Monday to Friday from 9 AM to 1 PM. I also want to include 5 hours of volunteer work and 2 hours of exercise each week. I prefer to study in the mornings and avoid working in the late afternoon. The date is 6/9/2023, please generate a three-day schedule including my internship hours.
input1_ans:
To create your schedule, I will first analyze your tasks and preferences. You have classes on Tuesday and Thursday from 9 AM to 11 AM. You need to allocate 15 hours for thesis research, with at least 5 hours for writing. You also have a part-time job that requires 20 hours a week, preferably in the afternoons. Additionally, you want to include 4 hours of exercise weekly and ensure that meal times are accounted for.

Given your preference not to work on weekends, I will distribute your tasks across the weekdays, ensuring that your schedule is balanced and includes breaks for meals and rest. I will also avoid scheduling any work during the class hours and will respect your preference for afternoons for your part-time job.

Here’s the proposed schedule for the week starting from 6/9/2023:

**Schedule Strategy:**
- Classes are scheduled first.
- Allocate time for thesis research and writing, ensuring at least 5 hours are dedicated to writing.
- Schedule part-time job hours in the afternoons.
- Include exercise sessions throughout the week.
- Ensure meal times are included and breaks are provided.

Now, here’s the schedule in CSV format:

This schedule includes your classes, thesis research, writing, part-time job, exercise, and meal breaks, while respecting your preferences and ensuring a balanced workload.

Based on your requirements, here’s a three-day schedule for you, including your classes, thesis work, part-time job, exercise, and meal times. The schedule is designed for Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, as you have classes on Tuesday and Thursday.

### Summary of Weekly Hours
- **Thesis Research**: 15 hours (2 hours on Tuesday, 3 hours on Wednesday, 2 hours on Thursday)
- **Thesis Writing**: 5 hours (1 hour on Tuesday, 1 hour on Wednesday, 1 hour on Thursday)
- **Part-time Job**: 20 hours (4 hours on Tuesday, 4 hours on Wednesday, 4 hours on Thursday)
- **Exercise**: 4 hours (1 hour each day)
- **Meal Breaks**: Scheduled throughout the day

This schedule ensures that you meet your thesis research and writing requirements while balancing your part-time job and exercise.
